title: DJ Sona release cost
body: I bought a bit of RP for when DJ {{champion:37}}  comes out, but I need to know if DJ {{champion:37}}  will be on sale at release, thanks.

replies.body:
Most likely the same or more than what Pulsefire Ezreal and Spirit Guard Udyr costs, so around 3250. Given the quality of the skin I wouldn't be surprised if 3250 is the sale price and the final price is >4k RP.

Don't be a moron. A skin in a video game isn't worth $30, unless you're wealthy or something (earning >$100k personally, not using your parents' money).
Everything is worth what people think it is worth. If someone enjoys the game and wants to drop $30 on a skin, that doesn't strike me as outrageous.

If you want to drop $30 on something you could always donate it to someone whose life depends on it via a charity...

Not gonna enter the debate here, but I would assume that the skin would be on sale for around the same amount the other ultimate skins were, or at least with around the same percentage of discount.
I say just this because Udyr got lots of special stuff with his, and Ezreal's transforms as he levels up, so Sona has a comparable amount of effects, I guess.

Pulsefire ezreal needs a visual update, or a price reduction.
Not a price reduction, just a visual update.

DJ Sona actually cost a lot more to make and has a ton more content than the other skins, which is why I guessed it'd cost more than the other two. 

It has over 3 hours of unique audio, which can combine in various ways such that an even larger amount of new material can be generated on the fly. I wouldn't go so far as to say "infinite" since the tunes will doubtlessly get repetitive eventually, but you get my point.

The audio was worked on by several different famous real life DJs, which would have cost a chunk of money to hire.

By comparison, Udyr and Ezreal are just some fancy visuals and a few extra cheap sound effects.
